language.type: String (ISO 639 Part 1 two-letter language code) or null

text.description: Plain-text source of a status. Returned instead of `content` when status is deleted, so the user may redraft from the source text without the client having to reverse-engineer the original text from the HTML content.

edited_at.description: Timestamp of when the status was last edited.

favourited.description: If the current token has an authorized user: Have you favourited this status?

reblogged.description: If the current token has an authorized user: Have you boosted this status?

muted.description: If the current token has an authorized user: Have you muted notifications for this status's conversation?

bookmarked.description: If the current token has an authorized user: Have you bookmarked this status?

pinned.description: If the current token has an authorized user: Have you pinned this status? Only appears if the status is pinnable.

filtered.description: If the current token has an authorized user: The filter and keywords that matched this status.

enum.hide_all: Always hide all media by default, regardless of sensitivity

id.type: String (cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number)

expires_at.type: String (ISO 8601 Datetime), or null if the filter does not expire

filter_action.description: The action to be taken when a status matches this filter.

enum.warn: show a warning that identifies the matching filter by `title`, and allow the user to expand the filtered status. This is the default (and unknown values should be treated as equivalent to `warn`).
enum.hide: do not show this status if it is received

filter_action.type_key: String (Enumerable, oneOf) `warn` = show a warning that identifies the matching filter by `title`, and allow the user to expand the filtered status. This is the default (and unknown values should be treated as equivalent to `warn`). `hide` = do not show this status if it is received

keywords.description: The keywords grouped under this filter.

statuses.description: The statuses grouped under this filter.

id.description: The id of the notification in the database.
id.type_key: String (cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number)
id.type: String (cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number)

type.description: The type of event that resulted in the notification.
type.type_key: String (Enumerable oneOf) `mention` = Someone mentioned you in their status `status` = Someone you enabled notifications for has posted a status `reblog` = Someone boosted one of your statuses `follow` = Someone followed you `follow_request` = Someone requested to follow you `favourite` = Someone favourited one of your statuses `poll` = A poll you have voted in or created has ended `update` = A status you interacted with has been edited `admin.sign_up` = Someone signed up (optionally sent to admins) `admin.report` = A new report has been filed
type.type: String (Enumerable oneOf) `mention` = Someone mentioned you in their status `status` = Someone you enabled notifications for has posted a status `reblog` = Someone boosted one of your statuses `follow` = Someone followed you `follow_request` = Someone requested to follow you `favourite` = Someone favourited one of your statuses `poll` = A poll you have voted in or created has ended `update` = A status you interacted with has been edited `admin.sign_up` = Someone signed up (optionally sent to admins) `admin.report` = A new report has been filed

account.description: The account that performed the action that generated the notification.

status.description: Status that was the object of the notification. Attached when `type` of the notification is `favourite`, `reblog`, `status`, `mention`, `poll`, or `update`.

report.description: Report that was the object of the notification. Attached when `type` of the notification is `admin.report`.

username.description: The username of the account, not including domain.

acct.description: The Webfinger account URI. Equal to `username` for local users, or `username@domain` for remote users.

url.description: The location of the user's profile page.

avatar.description: An image icon that is shown next to statuses and in the profile.

avatar_static.description: A static version of the avatar. Equal to `avatar` if its value is a static image; different if `avatar` is an animated GIF.

header.description: An image banner that is shown above the profile and in profile cards.

header_static.description: A static version of the header. Equal to `header` if its value is a static image; different if `header` is an animated GIF.

locked.description: Whether the account manually approves follow requests.

fields.description: Additional metadata attached to a profile as name-value pairs.

emojis.description: Custom emoji entities to be used when rendering the profile.

bot.description: Indicates that the account may perform automated actions, may not be monitored, or identifies as a robot.

group.description: Indicates that the account represents a Group actor.

discoverable.description: Whether the account has opted into discovery features such as the profile directory.

noindex.description: Whether the local user has opted out of being indexed by search engines.

moved.description: Indicates that the profile is currently inactive and that its user has moved to a new account.
moved.type_key: Account(), or null if the profile is suspended.
moved.type: Account(), or null if the profile is suspended.

suspended.description: An extra attribute returned only when an account is suspended.

limited.description: An extra attribute returned only when an account is silenced. If true, indicates that the account should be hidden behind a warning screen.

role.description: The role assigned to the currently authorized user.

mute_expires_at.type_key: String (ISO 8601 Datetime), or null if the mute is indefinite
mute_expires_at.type: String (ISO 8601 Datetime), or null if the mute is indefinite

name.description: The key of a given field's key-value pair.

value.description: The value associated with the `name` key.

verified_at.description: Timestamp of when the server verified a URL value for a rel="me" link.
verified_at.type_key: String (ISO 8601 Datetime) if `value` is a verified URL. Otherwise, null.
verified_at.type: String (ISO 8601 Datetime) if `value` is a verified URL. Otherwise, null.

id.description: The ID of the EmailDomainBlock in the database.
id.type_key: String (cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number)
id.type: String (cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number)

domain.description: The email domain that is not allowed to be used for signups.

created_at.description: When the email domain was disallowed from signups.

history.description: Usage statistics for given days (typically the past week).

day.description: UNIX timestamp on midnight of the given day.

accounts.description: The counted accounts signup attempts using that email domain within that day.

uses.description: The counted IP signup attempts of that email domain within that day.

type.description: The type of the preview card.

enum.rich: iframe OEmbed. Not currently accepted, so won't show up in practice.

type.type_key: String (Enumerable, oneOf) `link` = Link OEmbed `photo` = Photo OEmbed `video` = Video OEmbed `rich` = iframe OEmbed. Not currently accepted, so won't show up in practice.

author_name.description: The author of the original resource.

author_url.description: A link to the author of the original resource.

provider_name.description: The provider of the original resource.

provider_url.description: A link to the provider of the original resource.

html.description: HTML to be used for generating the preview card.

embed_url.description: Used for photo embeds, instead of custom `html`.

blurhash.description: A hash computed by the BlurHash algorithm(https://github.com/woltapp/blurhash), for generating colorful preview thumbnails when media has not been downloaded yet.

history.description: Usage statistics for given days (typically the past week).

day.description: UNIX timestamp on midnight of the given day.

accounts.description: The counted accounts using the link within that day.

uses.description: The counted statuses using the link within that day.

id.description: The ID of the attachment in the database.
id.type_key: String (cast from an integer but not guaranteed to be a number)
id.type: String (cast from an integer but not guaranteed to be a number)

type.type_key: String (Enumerable, oneOf) `unknown` = unsupported or unrecognized file type `image` = Static image `gifv` = Looping, soundless animation `video` = Video clip `audio` = Audio track

url.description: The location of the original full-size attachment.

preview_url.description: The location of a scaled-down preview of the attachment.

remote_url.description: The location of the full-size original attachment on the remote website.
remote_url.type_key: String (URL), or null if the attachment is local
remote_url.type: String (URL), or null if the attachment is local

version_history.2.3.0: added `meta.focus`  May contain subtrees `small` and `original`, as well as various other top-level properties.  More importantly, there may be another topl-level `focus` Hash object on images as of 2.3.0, with coordinates can be used for smart thumbnail cropping -- see [Focal points for cropped media thumbnails]({{< relref "api/guidelines#focal-points" >}}) for more.

description.description: Alternate text that describes what is in the media attachment, to be used for the visually impaired or when media attachments do not load.

blurhash.description: A hash computed by the BlurHash algorithm(https://github.com/woltapp/blurhash), for generating colorful preview thumbnails when media has not been downloaded yet.

text_url.description: A shorter URL for the attachment.

id.description: The ID of the filter in the database.
id.type_key: String (cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number)
id.type: String (cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number)

context.description: The contexts in which the filter should be applied.
context.type_key: Array of String (Enumerable anyOf) `home` = home timeline and lists `notifications` = notifications timeline `public` = public timelines `thread` = expanded thread of a detailed status `account` = when viewing a profile
context.type: Array of String (Enumerable anyOf) `home` = home timeline and lists `notifications` = notifications timeline `public` = public timelines `thread` = expanded thread of a detailed status `account` = when viewing a profile

expires_at.description: When the filter should no longer be applied.

expires_at.type: String (ISO 8601 Datetime), or null if the filter does not expire

irreversible.description: Should matching entities in home and notifications be dropped by the server? See implementation guidelines for filters().

whole_word.description: Should the filter consider word boundaries? See implementation guidelines for filters().

enum.no_access: Any activity from this IP range will be rejected entirely

id.type: String (cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number)

endpoint.description: Where push alerts will be sent to.

alerts.description: Which alerts should be delivered to the `endpoint`.

mention.description: Receive a push notification when someone else has mentioned you in a status?

status.description: Receive a push notification when a subscribed account posts a status?

reblog.description: Receive a push notification when a status you created has been boosted by someone else?

follow.description: Receive a push notification when someone has followed you?

follow_request.description: Receive a push notification when someone has requested to followed you?

favourite.description: Receive a push notification when a status you created has been favourited by someone else?

poll.description: Receive a push notification when a poll you voted in or created has ended?

update.description: Receive a push notification when a status you interacted with has been edited?

admin.sign_up.description: Receive a push notification when a new user has signed up?

admin.report.description: Receive a push notification when a new report has been filed?

id.description: The ID of the conversation in the database.

id.type: String (cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number)

unread.description: Is the conversation currently marked as unread?

last_status.description: The last status in the conversation.

key.description: The unique keystring for the requested measure.

unit.description: The units associated with this data item's value, if applicable.

total.description: The numeric total associated with the requested measure.

human_value.description: A human-readable formatted value for this data item.

previous_total.description: The numeric total associated with the requested measure, in the previous period. Previous period is calculated by subtracting the start_at and end_at dates, then offsetting both start and end dates backwards by the length of the time period.

data.description: The data available for the requested measure, split into daily buckets.

date.description: Midnight on the requested day in the time period.

value.description: The numeric value for the requested measure.

id.type: Integer

color.description: The hex code assigned to this role. If no hex code is assigned, the string will be empty.

permissions.description: A bitmask that represents the sum of all permissions granted to the role.

highlighted.description: Whether the role is publicly visible as a badge on user profiles.

id.type: String (cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number)
